info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 01 at 12:02PM EDT until April 01 at 12:45PM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 PM EDT FOR LORAIN COUNTY... At 1201 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 13 miles north of Western Vermilion to Wakeman to 7 miles west of New London, moving east at 60 mph. Additional thunderstorms developing over Lorain County ahead of this line. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Lorain, Elyria, Vermilion, Western Vermilion, Westlake, North Ridgeville, Avon Lake, Amherst, Grafton, Wellington, North Olmsted, Avon, Bay Village, Sheffield Lake, Olmsted Falls, Eaton, Oberlin, Sheffield, Lagrange and Penfield. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Strong wind gusts in excess of 50 mph will continue even after the rain exits. This is a DANGEROUS SITUATION. These storms are producing widespread wind damage across western Lorain County. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.
